Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Cyclopsychotride A (CPT; natural AMPs; XXC; cyclotides; UCBB1aB; 3S=S; flowering seed plants)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification:  It is cyclic and contains three disulfide bonds:4,21; 8,23; 13,28.Activity: Active against Gram- E. coli (MIC 1.55 uM), P. aeruginosa (MIC 13.5 uM), P. vulgaris (MIC 13.2 uM), K. oxytoca (MIC 5.8 uM), Gram+ S. aureus (MIC 39 uM), M. luteus (MIC 48 uM), fungi C.albicans (MIC > 500 uM), C. kefyr (MIC 14.0 uM), and C. tropicalis (MIC 56.5 uM).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (100 mM); NaCl-insensitive:K. oxytoca (100 mM); NaCl-insensitive:C. kefyr (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:P. vulgaris (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:S. aureus (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:M. luteus (100 mM); NaCl-sensitive:C. tropicalis (100 mM) (See ref AP00729, Tam JP et al. PNAS 96:8913-8).Updated 8/2008; 11/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Witherup KM, Bogusky MJ, Anderson PS, Ramjit H, Ransom RW, Wood T, Sardana M1994
Literature Information.Title: Cyclopsychotride A, a biologically active, 31-residue cyclic peptide isolated from Psychotria longipes.
